text:
Hi Sam, I'm Joel a vfx supe at DNEG and your new mentor.
Sorry for delay in getting in touch, have just got back from a weeks "holiday" at the seaside. Got back to London late last night as the lockdown hit. I understand you are keen to get into vfx! I am more than happy to help in any way I can. My background is in CG, I started as a generalist CG artist at dneg back in 2006 and worked my way up through mainly lighting and look dev to become a CG supervisor. Dabbled with model/texture/fx type years back but focused more on technical director type work specialising in lighting and look dev before transitioning into supervision. Now I work as vfx supervisor, so overseeing all of the work DNEG does on a project. I just finished work on the new Bond film (before the release date was pushed due to Corona!). In this role I help direct the approach to the work and try to direct the look and improve the quality of everything. But basically means I spend a lot of time criticing other peoples work and rarely get a chance to do hands on stuff myself!
Please let me know where you are with your studies and what kind of things interest you and I will do my best to assist and advise where I can! Would be great to get a little background from you and then we can chat further.
I am working from home remoting into the office which is a novel change as it has always been forbidden due to security measures so all a bit strange right now.
My motivation for signing up as a mentor is that I appreciate how much harder it is to get into the industry now compared to when I graduated and I have some spare time now the insanity of finishing Bond is over! I was very lucky to join the industry at a good time and I want to pass on some of my experience to others.
Cheers Joel
Hi Joel, sorry that I've taken so long to reply, this whole coronavirus situation has really messed my timeline up. I'm all ready to go
Could you tell me more about what your role entailed with DNEG?
